      • getSkinForPlayer

        public IProperty getSkinForPlayer​(String name,
                                  boolean silent)
                           throws SkinRequestException
        This method seeks out a players actual skin (chosen or not) and returns either null (if no skin data found) or the property containing all the skin data. It also schedules a skin update to stay up to date with skin changes.
        Parameters:
        name - Player name to search skin for
        silent - Whether to throw errors or not
        Throws:
        SkinRequestException - If MojangAPI lookup errors

      • getSkinName

        public Optional<String> getSkinName​(String playerName)
        Returns a players custom skin.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the players name
        Returns:
        the custom skin name a player has set or null if not set

      • getSkinData

        public IProperty getSkinData​(String skinName,
                             boolean updateOutdated)
        Returns property object containing skin data of the wanted skin
        Parameters:
        skinName - Skin name
        updateOutdated - On true, we update the skin if expired

      • updateSkinData

        public boolean updateSkinData​(String skinName)
                       throws SkinRequestException
        Parameters:
        skinName - Skin name
        Returns:
        true on updated
        Throws:
        SkinRequestException - On updating disabled OR invalid username + api error

      • getDefaultSkinName

        public String getDefaultSkinName​(String playerName)
        See Also:
        getDefaultSkinName(String, boolean)

      • getDefaultSkinName

        public String getDefaultSkinName​(String playerName,
                                 boolean clear)
        Filters player name to exclude non [a-z_] Checks and process default skin. IF no default skin: 1: Return player if clear 2: Return skin if found Else: return player
        Parameters:
        playerName - Player name
        clear - return player instead of his set skin
        Returns:
        setSkin or DefaultSkin, if player has no setSkin or default skin, we return his name
